palette.title: Open Air Cinema
palette.description: My Favourite Films: "Ein Lied von Liebe und Tod - Gloomy Sunday" (1999) It was one of the first tear-jerking films I ever wanted to watch again (I usually avoid heart-breaking films, but this one is just too beautiful). The plot is about a love triangle during Nazi time in Budapest...and that song, "Gloomy Sunday", must be one of the most beautiful and sad melodiesI have ever heard, it makes the film what it is. Well, this movie has everything - romance, intellect, beautiful pictures and melodies. I really need to watch it again soon... "Across the Universe" (2007) A musical-like movie with the sounds of The Beatles. The scene which impressed me most was the 'Strawberry Fields Forever" scene: Strawberries, red paint, blood, Vietnam war and the agressive sound of the Beatles' song - one of the most intense moments I ever had while watching a film. "Lost Highway" (1997) Most confusing and eerie - it's unforgiveable that I haven't tried any other Lynch films yet, I definitely will! And Bowie's "Deranged" is perfect for it!! "Amélie" (2001) Lovely film, lovely music, lovely actress - I think it brought quite some innovation to the movie world! "Melancholia" (2011) I watched it with my friend in an open air cinema at night, clear sky - I was expecting Melancholia to crash into us any moment. Wonderful movie experience!
